data.title: Creighton University Athletics
data.meta_description: OMAHA, Neb. -- Creighton center Brody Deren has been named an all-District pick by the United States Basketball Writers Association. Deren was one of 10 all-District
data.text:
OMAHA, Neb. -- Creighton center Brody Deren has been named an all-District pick by the United States Basketball Writers Association. Deren was one of 10 all-District 6 picks named to the team, which was voted on by USBWA members nationwide.

District 6 consists of student-athletes competing for schools from the states of Iowa, Missouri, Kansas, Oklahoma, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota. Members of the District 6 team were Wayne Simien and Keith Langford of Kansas, Tony Allen and John Lucas of Oklahoma State, Ricky Paulding and Arthur Johnson of Missouri, Iowa State's Curtis Stinson, Nebraska's Nate Johnson, Northern Iowa's David Gruber and Creightonâ€™s Brody Deren.

Deren, a first-team all-Missouri Valley Conference pick, leads Creighton with 6.7 rebounds per game and ranks second on the team with 10.6 points and 1.1 blocked shots per game. He also ranks among the league leaders in field goal percentage.

The Bluejays are 20-8 on the season and tied for second in the MVC with a 12-6 league mark. Creighton will learn its postseason fate on Sunday evening when pairings for the NCAA Tournament and National Invitation Tournament are announced.

This isn't the first time the national writers have honored Creighton. Last season, Kyle Korver was named the USBWA District 6 Player of the Year while head coach Dana Altman was named USBWA District 6 Coach of the Year. Korver was also an all-district pick as a junior.
